chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ward D Hay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Defendant to provide a current address to the Clerk of Courts Office.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit. The court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.

from DE requesting to be allowed to use huber privileges for Dr. appointments
JOC returned by USPS - Attempted Not Known - Unable to Forward

Case called @ 11:46 a.m. Defendant Ward D Hay in court with attorney David Paul Frank Templeton.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Misd Poss of THC.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 3 - DRI. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Templeton. Court orders: S/W 18 mos probation - Conditions: Ct 1 only - 30 days WCJ - Huber, No GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than 8/1/2015, As to both counts - AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. The defendant is required to provide new address to the Clerk of Courts Office by no later than 4:30 today. The court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.  Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney David Paul Frank Templeton in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Templeton states matter can be set for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Case called @ 2:19 p.m. Defendant Ward D Hay in court with attorney David Paul Frank Templeton.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG plea entered. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 03:05 pm.

Defendant is to provide the Clerk of Courts office of current address.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

1:31 pm case called. Defendant Ward D Hay in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Ward D Hay in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint stated-confirm receipt, reading waived.   Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
